website_summaries.verdict: A rainbow of colors for sensory play, these water beads are inexpensive and have a lot of play and decoration uses.
pros: No chemical smell, like some other water beads
Put them in water and they expand
Very fun for kids and adults to play with
Soothing for kids with sensory issues
Lots of colors allows you to make a sorting game out of the beads
cons: These beads seem to break apart if you leave them soaking in water for too long

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating stuff, man.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? We pour a bunch into our two year old daughter's water table, and then she watches them grow and loves to play with them. No matter what we're doing in the house, she will frequently stop to announce "back yard, play water beads now! Here's a secret: I sometimes catch my wife alone in the backyard, playing with the water beads. She is fascinated by them. A grown ass woman. Just sitting there, squishing the water beads by herself. What a weirdo.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: amazing with hot water and 6hours filledup my very large laundry basket with 30gal trash bag inside it
customer_reviews.author: kara ozley

customer_reviews.title: My students LOVE these beads
customer_reviews.text: My students LOVE these beads! The feel of them is AWESOME! They even make a great stress ball reliever! I use them at my "Calm Down" desk. They are great for building my student's fine motor skills. I set up a color sorting center. They used small measuring spoons to scoop them into smaller cups for sorting and counting. I used them with my DoodleHog Art Trays. They are the perfect depth to hold the beads so they don't roll out and onto the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: So I bought these for my son who has Autism ...
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these for my son who has Autism. He has sensory disorders and we filled the bathtub with these and let him lay in them. Keep in mind that you have to let them sit in water for 6 hours. We filled the tub, let them set, and the next day we added warm water and he was able to swim around in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Worst chia seeds ever!  They make great toys for kids and adults though.
customer_reviews.text: Worst chia seeds ever! I spread these over my neighbors cement lions one night and the next day it looked like a bunch of clowns had a party with the statue. Boo! In all seriousness these beads were a lot of fun for me and the kids who played with them. I used some of them them to test some ideas on evaporation during a summer science project. It's amazing how long these hold water in 90~120 degree heat. Good product and recommended to anyone wanting A LOT of water beads.
customer_reviews.author: bigfooty

customer_reviews.title: More than you'll ever use
customer_reviews.text: This came as a pack absolutely bulging with beads. Since a few in the palm of your hand will expand to fill a decent sized bowl- this one pack has enough beads for every kid in the neighborhood to play with. They aren't exactly exciting 'toys' for kids but make for a colorful distraction. They might have more application in crafts or gardening. Beware these are smaller than marbles when full, and are easily swallowed by small children and pets.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sollenberger

customer_reviews.title: so many water beads
customer_reviews.text: First, these are super fun. BUT, they will take over! We put about half the package in a kiddie pool with water for the kids. For sure there was too much water, as these got enormous and many of them split open. But even the ones that didn't, took almost four days to dry out - and that was laying them out in a single layer in the sun. Anything we had touching other beads - even in a colander - never dried out. We ended up pitching a bunch of them because we weren't sure they'd ever shrink back down, and just having a bunch of buckets of water beads everywhere was getting strange.
customer_reviews.author: K. DeLap

customer_reviews.title: 2 different sizes and the larger ones crumble
customer_reviews.text: I just tried these and let them sit over night; some of them expanded larger than others. The cup still had some water in it so I know it's not because there wasn't enough water. The bigger beads easily broke just by moving my hands through the beads. The smaller beads did not have this problem. If the bag was only the small beads, I would have given it 4 stars. Also, the starting bead is teeny tiny so definately not for younger children. But overall, for the price, I think the older kids I bought these for will have fun with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Just like Orbeez
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son to play inside in a water table. He loves them and finds them very soothing. He enjoys playing with them in different ways like hiding toys, pretending it's ice cream, counting, with construction toys, etc. They are durable. We have used a batch,dried it out and reused about 4 times and it still works great. I also feel this grow quicker vs other brands (great for impatient little ones).
customer_reviews.author: JOAM228

customer_reviews.title: Slimy reside on hands
customer_reviews.text: Yuck. Leaves slimy residue on hands. As an OT, these beads will be double aversive to kiddos with tactile defensiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: these things are cool
customer_reviews.text: I see these always advertised as good for kids with sensory issues and things like that. Let me tell you, it's not just for them. I love these things. Add them to a glass jar, put some water in and you have a nice colorful jar of colorful beads. I told people at work and brought some in, added water and now everyone wants some. It's a real crowd pleaser and everyone is interested in them. I think the amount that are included would fill a 10 gallon fish tank when fully expanded. I just put a tablespoon full of these in a large jar and it spilled over the top after absorbing all the water. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, breaks apart easily
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these as much as my toddler does, but I don't. They break apart way too easily. In less than 2 hours I picked out 40+ broken ones. I actually spent more time picking out broken ones than playing with my son, so much so that he stopped playing and started picking out broken ones as well. We will definitely be trying a better brand, but these are a waste of money, unless you plan to use them for decorating/plants. No way I would reuse them for sensory play, I don't believe the few that didn't break would hold up to a second round.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Relatively cheap and clean fun
customer_reviews.text: These occupied my kids for hours over the a couple of days. Great way to pas the time if you’re still quarantined. Follow the instructions and don’t allow them to sit too long in water or they’ll start to break like in my photo. We made two “batches”, each being a teaspoon of beads to 3 cups of water, and you can see below my hand this makes a large quantity.
customer_reviews.author: greenbeancounter

customer_reviews.title: LOVE WATER BEADS
customer_reviews.text: I'm so impressed with the quality of these beads! They really expand! I was so impressed with it! I made a sensory bottle with them, great for sensory play!!!!or to fill a jar for decoration!
customer_reviews.author: rosana

customer_reviews.title: Summertime fun
customer_reviews.text: It is hotter than the surface of the sun here in TX, and these water beads are a fun indoor thing to play with. I have them in a water table, and they have provided hours of entertainment. I measured two tablespoons into a big container and let them soak overnight, and they were nice and marble-sized in the morning. *a little goes a long way! One small bag will last us quite a while. After a few days of heavy play, they started to split/break down, so I popped them in my potted plants, where they will eventually shrink and water my plants at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: annakay

customer_reviews.title: FUN!
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughters and I spent several hours playing happily with the water beads. I had soaked them before going to their house but as I tried to show them how small they start as and grow to this big I spilled some. Thank goodness I had placed a large mat on the floor so there were no problems anyway they also got to experience how fast the beads can expand. Granddaughters are 2 and 4. I had also brought several containers and cups from the Dollar Store so there were lots of ways to play plus we had a designated bag to put the broken ones in which also added to the entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: webbizy

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these! I small amount goes a long way and they can be dried and used again and again. They do occasionally break, so I throw the broken ones out, but there are always plenty more beads to replace them. They say to soak for 8 hours (I think), but realistically, you can play with them sooner. Maybe after about 2 hours. They grow quickly, but probably don't reach their full size for about 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Not for children! Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: I know a lot or therapists and teachers buy these for children, but I highly suggest you not. My 5.5 year old shoved one deep into his ear which resulted in an ER trip and emergency ENT visit. Turns out it’s a common problem. We used these under adult supervision, but he snuck one of the balls and put it in his ear. My son used these for sensory therapy. Getting this stuck in your ear is quick and it is not obvious the child is doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rose

customer_reviews.title: Breaks so easily, but fun toy
customer_reviews.text: My kids have been so bored at home since Covid19, so I ordered these water beads. I think this is a great playing item for kids, but it breaks soo easily. After playing with this, almost half of them was broken and it is so hard to clean up. BUT, good thing is, if you order this, you will play with this forever (bc there is a lot of water beads inside).
customer_reviews.author: Cindy P.

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for Christmas for my daughter, and she LOVES these! They're a little bit bigger than the Orbeez beads, which she loves. This is definitely worth the purchase, especially for the price, and the amount of beads you get. Great value, great service, and definitely something we'll be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerTop Contributor: Harry Potter

customer_reviews.title: Fun but crazy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take on a family vacation to a cabin. I thought the kids would have fun playing in them and they absolutely did. But I put too many into the bowl that I originally filled with water. The directions said a teaspoon or a tablespoon (can't remember this moment) and then 3 cups of water. Well that didn't look like enough for 6 kids to play with so I dumped in a bit more. Well it was WAY WAY too many. The only that was hard was that the younger kids would break them and then the broken pieces got everywhere. So this is an outside activity or an inside activity for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: Best sensory fun in a bag!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sensory for toddlers! The package comes as pictured. Seems minimal but after this 1st use (pictured) it's clear that my 8oz bag will last a while. The package recommends 6 - 10 hours but I let the kiddos attack it after 4. Love the variety of colors & the kids love pinching them to make crushed jelly ~ Lol. Great product for keeping the kiddos occupied (with supervision, of course, by a responsible person) so we (parents) can get things done. 1st photo : beads after 1 hour 2nd photo : beads after 4 hours (playable by this time) 3rd photo : beads color/size (after 4 hours only)
customer_reviews.author: Echobeauty

customer_reviews.title: I keep coming back for more
customer_reviews.text: The water beads are so fun for kids (... and adults too, not going to lie...) The hydration process goes fast - if you use warm water they will expand to near full size in a couple of hours. For best results I let them sit over night in a large container. I have used these: - At my kids' birthday parties as part of the activities and party favors - Kiddo's water table for some added fun/texture - Decorations - Vases - Bought several for birthday gifts Haven't had a bad batch yet and I think we've ordered from this vendor at least 5 times now.
customer_reviews.author: Epiphany54

customer_reviews.title: Used them in a water table and it was a blast
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved these beads. I used them in a water table for an entertainment for my daughter BD party. We had kids from 18 months to 8 years old and they all enjoyed it. I used almost 25 teaspoon of beads and the appropriate amount of water for the water table. I still have some left for another occasion. Very affordable entertainment for parties. Just bare in mind that it is not a good idea to have in indoor without supervision. When kids drop them at the floor and people walk on them, it creates a slippery messy situation. It was totally OK for the backyard but if you are planning to use it inside, arrange accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Marzieh

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for Water Beads!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! I purchased this for my nephew and he loves it! It amazes him as it transitioned to small plastic balls into a bigger size as it absorbed the water after about 6hours. Instruction provided was clear as well. Delivery was on time and the box that the material was in was clean and organized. I’d highly recommend this product. However, make sure to keep an eye on kids who are still toddlers, they may put this in their mouth and it may become a choking hazard. Otherwise, it is a great price for an abundance amount provided to you. You can also use these to decorate plants, science project, or create stress ball!!! Highly Recommended! Christina
customer_reviews.author: Chri5tinah

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal and easy to make.
customer_reviews.text: I was confused at first because I thought the bag looked very small for the amount that was promised, don’t be fooled. It literally only takes about five teaspoons to fill a shoe box storage size plastic container. This is such a better deal than buying at the store. I went to Target recently and they had pre made ones (about 1.5 cups worth) and it was $5.99. It only takes me about 6 hours to make a full batch and they last quite a while. After about 3-4 weeks they get a little slimy and I’ll toss and make a new batch. Very worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jena Miao

customer_reviews.title: Tiny beads grew to big globes. Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't exactly know what it was before I bought it. My 8 year old daughter sent me the link to the product and asked me to buy it. It was very tiny when we received it. We soaked it in water overnight. Next day, it grew to awesome shiny globes. Less than half the pouch of them grew to half a bucket. We still have more than half. We soaked them in homedepot bucket. It looks and feels great. It is bouncy. I still have no idea what the purpose of it is.
customer_reviews.author: ganesh usha

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Lot for the price. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: We have used another brand of these for my child’s OT appointments. The beads from OT were very sturdy and did not burst easily. They loved them so much I bought some from home. I am impressed with how many water beads come for the price but the quality is very poor. These beads burst so easily. I mean so easily. My 1 year old has no problem squishing them in his hands. Pros: so many beads Cons: having to constantly make more to replace broken ones. I am hoping I just got a bad batch. Will definitely be looking to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Vidinhar Family

customer_reviews.title: This bag may last forever!
customer_reviews.text: Endless fun! We follow the bag instructions and make 1 or 2 tablespoons at a time. They last a long time and when they do dry out you can reuse them so unless we want to fill a kiddy pool with them sometime they may last forever. Some do crack/break and we discard those right away but it's a very small percentage. My two year old loves color sorting them into a muffin tin or using them with her play dishes and measuring devices. They are really fun in shaving cream too. A great addition to the rainy day bin.
customer_reviews.author: MissEnota

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fun!  Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a home daycare. My kids had a blast. We mixed this package with a small pack of larger beads. Kids had a blast. Remember the longer you soak the easier they are to break. I would suggest not more than 5 hours. Then drain water. We filled up a water table with water and added beads at 10am. Went back after nap atb3pm and they were perfect. We drained and played for several hours. The table was full!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I love that these came in a resealable bag. They had great directions. I put a bowl out at my son’s birthday party, and the small kids, teens, and adults all played with them. However, be careful not to put them next to food! One guest thought they were tapioca pearls (like you see in Boba tea), and we all had a good laugh. Thankfully, she asked before she ate. 😂 I thought this was better than kinetic sand. So much more for your money. Colors are bright and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Karaday

customer_reviews.title: Great colors!
customer_reviews.text: These water beads are more brightly colored than other beads I have bought. We enjoyed how beautiful they are. I bought them for my grandchildren to play with during a recent visit. I used a blue plastic kiddie pool and put the entire bag in. The beads , when hydrated, filled the pool about halfway. This was perfect for them. There were 5 children from 1- to 7-years-old. Yes, it is indicated on the package for 3 and up, we closely supervised the 1-year-old and 2-year-old, they loved them too! The grandchildren spent the entire afternoon outside playing with these water beads and didn't want to go home.
customer_reviews.author: hikingchic

customer_reviews.title: tv no longer a babysitter...try these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: if you want something to entertain/mesmerize young children...THIS IS IT!!!!! i had a picnic...added water & these water beads in a small baby pool & it kept all the 2-6 yr olds busy for hours....(of course, they had to have some supervision...but no one put them in their mouths after being told not to) SUPER GREAT ACTIVITY to just have the kids touch them feel them & try to gather them up!!!! way cool!!! highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: amarok

customer_reviews.title: These are delightful!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I love these! I bought them for myself because I thought it might feel kind of spa like to stick my feet in them but, that was sort of too cold. Instead, I've been using them as decorative alternatives to watering my flowers. I let them dial the 8 hours or so and then sort them by colors in layers in Mason jars. Then just add flowers. These are calming to play with and the colors are delightful. These bring joy and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.text: These water beads didn't become full circles, they were disformed, and many of them fell apart just by touching them. There is no way I would even allow children to play with these, they were also slimy and felt nasty to the touch. They took longer than usual to even grow but were still disformed and falling apart. I am very unsatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alliyaha Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: Must have for kids with mood disorders
customer_reviews.text: Love that they can be filled dried out then refilled. My son’s adhd disregulation is immensely helped by sifting through these. They’re very bouncy and slipperu when wet which makes it fun to try to catch them when they spill out of the bowl. Comes with a lot of them. Because they’re re-usable it’s a good deal if bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids birthday parties
customer_reviews.text: These make gorgeous large beads that hold up really well. I've used them for 2 birthday parties. 1. Put them into kiddy pool and left them overnight. I threw in a bunch of small aquatic toys and the kids had a great time fishing them out. Throwing then back in and repeat. Ages 2-5 2. It was such a hit this year I'm using them as part of the gift bags. FYI 1 bag makes 31 gifts - 1 teaspoon measure.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: Super fun to play with and uses such a tiny amount!
customer_reviews.text: I was so curious to see how 1 teaspoon of the dry beads and almost a quart of water, could absorb all of that and grow so much in size, so fast. That tiny amount, once they absorbed the water, turned out to be a full quart ziplock bag full! They could have gotten bigger if o let them keep going, I was afraid of them getting mushy tho. They ended up being the size of a marble. Once I was done playing with them, I put them in my flower pot and dry out!
customer_reviews.author: Holly B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids.
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 a teaspoon of the dried beads made 103 marble size beads once fully hydrated in about 3 hours. They were very sturdy the first day and bounced quite a few times if dropped. On the 3rd day they were still full size, but they had become more fragile and would split if dropped. Most could still be handled gently, but some broke even with gentle play. The dried colors are not a good reflection of what the finished product looks like. The beads I thought would be black were actually a pale blue once hydrated, and the deep red became a pale pink.
customer_reviews.author: Etznab

customer_reviews.title: FUN!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this. They swell up to a good size. I soaked them overnight and then dumped them into a kiddie pool with some more water for my sons birthday party and it was a huge hit. And after the party we used a colander to scoop them out back into buckets and I let them dehydrate back to normal size then I buried them in my flower beds so they can slow release water into the soil on hotter days. Great little things!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Feels squishy and my kids love it.
customer_reviews.text: After about an hour they got big and soft and super squishy. I think I might have liked this more than my 2 year olds! But they are fun to have the kids stick their hands in and squish around. We used a big giant bowl with a few of their toys. I could see filling up a bathtub with these as like the most fun ever. There are a boat load of these beads so you can easily get 10 different sessions or more with this bag of beads. I was surprised how they don’t feel sticky or gooey on your hands. Very hard to describe but these things are cool.
customer_reviews.author: Milt Drucker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: These are really awesome!! I purchased these after searching through many water bead options. I always read the reviews on any possible prospects. I noted someone mentioned these had no odor, and of course we are strictly looking for something non-toxic, which these state they are.. super important. These beads provide an excellent sensory activity which is why they were purchased. So fun!! We are all enjoying them. They have very lovely colors and are very easy to use. And yes, NO odor at all. We will purchase these again when we run out I am sure! I also purchased a set of sea animals to accompany play!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Wren

customer_reviews.title: Good size beads!
customer_reviews.text: Better beads than other brand. These are bigger than some other water beads we’ve tried. When fully soaked they are about the size of marbles. The other ones we had got no bigger than large pea size. One small omg if this fills up a great big tote up about 3/4 foot high- a good amount of beads. My 3 yr old and 5 yr old can get in the tote together and sit in them! Great buy! After the kids have used them up I chop them up in the blender and put them in my flower beds as I’m sure this may help regain some moisture I the soil for the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Decent value- decent quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bag says there’s 20,000 beads but that has to be incorrect. More like 2000. Bag is a lot smaller than I was expecting but I’m pretty happy with the quality so far. We put them in my sons water table and took about 4 hours to become full size. Some are duds but not enough to be upset over. We’ve had them outside in the table for 6 days now/ and they are still going strong. When they start to shrink we just add more water. When we come across broken ones (mostly the clear ones for some reason) we just toss them out. Overall, can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: kelly s

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when purchasing these beads because the price seemed extremely cheap. However, these are ammmmazing!! My 5 & 3 year old have spent hours playing with these. They are great for fine motor skills while using the little tools we bought to go with these. Honestly I will be buying more of these soon! They absolutely love them. MUCH easier to clean up than the kinetic sand they also love.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Kids LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: These are such a wonderful addition to outdoor play! Perfect for spring and fall when the weather might be too chilly for water play but you want to be outside. My kids love these! They hide figurines in them, have rolling ball races down the driveway, and just love feeling them in their hands. The day before they play with them, I just put a few TEASPOONS into a big bowl, fill with water, and let them sit overnight and they are ready to go in the morning! I have put them into the bowl in the morning with WARM water, run our errands, and they are ready to be played with after lunch. Love these beads!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waterbeads are waterbeads
customer_reviews.text: These things are so cool! I bloomed two teaspoons of them. What a mistake. Now there are too many beads! Luckily I'm using them in vases to keep my flowers hydrated. They look lovely in a vase. My kids play with them non stop. I personally like to squish them. I'm giving some to my boyfriend's sister because she saw the pictures I posted on Facebook and she wanted them too!
customer_reviews.author: Lausy mom

customer_reviews.title: Kids Loved Them
customer_reviews.text: I had a group of kids over and we put these in our old water table. While I was busy, they had an "orbeez fight." We ended up with a lot of broken water beads all over the lawn, but the kids had a lot of fun. After the friends left, my kids spent days sorting the beads and watching them shrink. We keep the beads covered with a towel so that flies won't find them, but they have been shrinking nicely. We gave each child a tablespoon of beads to take home and still had plenty left for us. These were a great find.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my year and a half old granddaughter. Although she is under the age of the recommended age to play with these. We watch her like a hawk and she was under supervision at all times so she wouldn't try to eat them. She loves the texture and the feel of them and keeps her busy for quite some time. I highly recommend them but definitely supervise the child at all times
customer_reviews.author: SammyT

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these water beads! I’ve tried a variety of brands and love this one. The colors are beautiful and vibrant, and you get a great amount for the price. My daughter loves them in any form: bowl, kiddie pool, balloon, it’s always a big hit! The only thing I would note would be to follow the amount of water indicated on the directions. When I filled my kiddie pool I didn’t measure it out which led to the beads becoming over saturated and eventually breaking. They warn you of this. Just follow the directions and you’ll love them!
customer_reviews.author: Abby L.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: These beads are great!!! My son has sensory prossesing disorder and playing with these beads make him so very happy! I get excited seeing just how happy these water beads make him when he's playing with them. And it's wonderful to know that such an inexpensive toy can bring hours and hours of pleasure to him. I plan on purchasing you several more bags of these not only for my kids, but to give away as gifts as well. Also the product arrived very quickly, and was packaged very very well. I have nothing but great things to say about the product and the seller. Thank you very much!
customer_reviews.author: Izzy and Evey's Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Wait until you run your fingers through them. So satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I buy way to much stuff for my grandkids. lol. The both love these. One of them outs them in her wading pools dn bath tub. The other on just loves to keep some in a bowl and run them through his fingers. They are pretty amazing the way they enlarge when put in water. When they dry put you can start all over again. So much fun and they will last forever. One little handful will fill up a bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kae Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: hours of play
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 year old and 5 year old loved them! We got 20,000. They do have to soak for a while to 'inflate'. We then put them in the bath with our girls. Lots of play time. It seemed some get too big and 'bust' but that's fine stuff fun to play with. I wish there weren't as many clear ones because once they go in the water it didn't look like there are as many because of those. However if you want to reuse them, they are a pain to dry out.... They actually still are not back to normal
customer_reviews.author: Jana C

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun!
customer_reviews.text: We loved these but I tried drying them out for reuse and they just got gooey and moldy... Suggestion. Use a tiny amount at a time.... NOT the whole bag.
customer_reviews.author: KRizMama

customer_reviews.title: Nice size but break too easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for sensory play and to create stress balls for my gifted students. They are much bigger than the other brand I bought, but they also break MUCH more easily. I ended up putting them in the stress balls and letting the kids play with the other brand because these broke with very little pressure. (Some kids’ balls were goo inside really quickly because these break so easily.) Though they might be great for other uses, I wouldn’t purchase this brand again for sensory play.
customer_reviews.author: Kgoss

customer_reviews.title: Fun sensory bin activity for kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a sensory bin for my daughter and they were so much fun! Would highly recommend (but be vigilant with young kids, as they may be a choking hazard). I took a few handfuls and put them in a big (16 cup) bowl with water one morning, and they grew to full size by early that afternoon. I handed my kiddo a large kitchen spatula and she was entertained for a long while!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bouncy water beads
customer_reviews.text: If you’re buying for a sensory table, this will be the only package you will ever need. And may regret. The beads are bouncy, toddlers may try to eat them. Very dangerous, but fun to play with. It makes an astronomical amount. You only need like a teaspoon at a time, so this will last forever. Not sure how these fare on the environment, so I’ve been hesitant to use them again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Seem as good as genuine Orbeez
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these with some question as to how they would compare with genuine Orbeez. We had purchased some real ones from a local retailer, so we had a point of comparison). When these arrived, we grew ALL of them (yeah, amazing how much they grow from the biggie they are shipped in) in large storage type tub and let the grandkids go at them. There seems to be no difference between these and genuine Orbeez. Not sure about longevity, as we do not care. For the price, they are serving their purpose perfectly. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mildewman

customer_reviews.title: Beads, Beads, Beads
customer_reviews.text: These beads are amazing. I work with kids and this is one of my favorite activities to do! I just pour some beads in a container, add water, and let them grow to absorb the water. You can work on sorting the beads, finding things inside/around the beads, or just feel the slippery texture. The beads are easy to clean up fun for all. The colors are great and I find it soothing to just feel. The best part is that it comes with so many beads and a little goes a long way so the package will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Leah C

customer_reviews.title: Affordable easy fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: My girls love them! This was our first experience with them so I was a little confused when the instructions said 1 teaspoon and 3 cups of water. I put 2 teaspoons and 6 cups of water in a large mixing bowl. I ended up having to split into two bowls because they were overflowing. I have not tried to dry them out and reuse them yet but we are on day 3 of them being in food storage containers and so far so good. Even if they were not reusable I feel we have already got our money's worth. I didn't even use half the bag and I had enough from 2 teaspoons to fill 4 medium food containers!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Blasdell

customer_reviews.title: awesome. Perfect if they were like $6-8
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how they cost this much but they are suuuuuuuper fun. Whole bag filled a toddler's water table 1/2 way. Can't not touch them! The whole family, even the dogs and a couple yard toads made their way over to check them out. Non toxic and bio degradable is a huge plus because they WILL get everywhere. Took about 4 hours to puff all the way up. Got a surprise giant one!
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2.5 year old to play with and she LOVES them! I usually put them in a shallow rubbermaid container and use 3 teaspoons, which doesn't seem like a lot but once they enlarge seems like so many! My 7 month old loves them as well. I let him "splash" around in the container and put his feet in it. I myself find them enjoyable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, larger size. Fast shipping! Lot’s of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are reusable. I liked that they were a nice larger size and multicolored. I wish they had a larger sized pack than this. More like a bucket to fill a large pool! Just order at least 6 packs if you want to fill a medium pool. Possibly more if not a kiddy pool lol! My daughter really enjoys these in the pool! Great for birthday parties!
customer_reviews.author: ashley flueckiger

customer_reviews.title: The picture is misleading as far as volume.
customer_reviews.text: If you think you are getting a package that looks like the picture, think again. You get what you are supposed to get, 8oz of beads, but people might expect to get what is pictured. I have attached a picture so you have have a clearer idea what 8oz of beads actually look like (its not near as much as I thought based on their picture).
customer_reviews.author: T shopper

customer_reviews.title: Toddler approved!
customer_reviews.text: We use these as a fun activity for our toddler. She loves these and will spend hours playing with them. I set them up in a bowl and give her another pan and some measuring cups for her to move them back and forth. They say they’re reusable but after a lot of toddler interaction, some of the beads break and it’s easier to just throw them away when she’s done playing for the day. It doesn’t take much to have a good time! This bag will last us a long time!
customer_reviews.author: LTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Soooooo many beads!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I bought one package and divided it up between my 3 kids. They have each used less than 1/4 tsp of beads to date, and we have way too many water beads. We have even given away a bunch and still have too many water beads. They blow up to be pretty big if you soak them in a lot of water, and the kids are just having a blast with them. It may seem like a tiny package of water beads, but it will be more than enough for basic fun.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for toddlers and adults
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun, I probably like them more than my 2year old.. well he just likes things for like 5 minutes (you know, toddlers), but months later I still play with these, I find them very stress relieving, like mini stress balls. I kinda want to fill a bath with them and just relax and squish them,is that weird? Overall great product, arrive on time and good packaging and price
customer_reviews.author: Libertadhs

customer_reviews.title: Cheap,  good fun for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Omgosh you'll have water beads for 10 years with just this little bag. My toddlers school uses these as sensory play, so we bought some to put in his christmas stocking this year. We put a couple tablespoons in a mason jar to plump them up, then let him go nuts with our Tupperware as he pours, sorts and shakes. A little slimy, but great fun!
customer_reviews.author: L.Hippensteel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a tool for potty training and good behavior. He would earn beads for the good things that he did. It's hard to count them out (I wasn't thinking it through), so I used spoonfuls instead of counting individual beads. Then on the weekend we soaked them. There's soooooooooooo many beads and they are really cool to watch and play with.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again for sure
customer_reviews.text: We have gotten several uses out of these and I’m not even halfway through the bag. These are fun even for adults, not to mention for valuable sensory play for the kiddos. Takes about 5-6 hours to fully turn into water beads but it’s worth the wait. I recommend getting some little kids science tools to pick them up and squish them with. We did and the kids spent well over an hour playing with them. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Hurley

customer_reviews.title: BIG, colorful water beads! Fun for adults!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought these for my kids but my (27 year old) cousin and I spent the weekend playing with these. They are intoxicating. When she went home, she ordered herself some! LOL! I've purchased other water beads before, this brand comes with better colors (imho), they get way bigger, and are harder to break. I'd definitely order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We bought these to fill a sensory table this summer and had soooo much fun! On the one of the last days fo ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is obsessed with orbeeze, thank you youtube! We bought these to fill a sensory table this summer and had soooo much fun! On the one of the last days fo the summer, we filled up a paddling pool and let our 4 year old and 2 year old enjoy a pool or water beads! This is actually only about 1/4 cup of dry beads, and they weren't full size when the kids went swimming, but they just couldn't wait any longer!
customer_reviews.author: Tiphphinne

customer_reviews.title: Great products!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this planning to fill out little bottles to give to my daughter's class as class gifts for Valentine's Day. After I filled out 27 small bottles, we had left over beads so my daughter had placed them in a container and beads had been growing into a good size jelly balls. Great products and colors of the jelly balls are very nice!!
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Mom

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long to shrink back down!
customer_reviews.text: These absorbed the water and got much bigger as advertised. However it takes way too longer for them to shrink back down. It's been 10 days and they still have a ways to go. It's 90+ degrees here and I even put them outside after a week. I've had water beads before and they were back to their original size in a day or so. I suggest you put them in something you're not going to need for a while.
customer_reviews.author: justjessieB

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a short amount of time.
customer_reviews.text: We followed the directions and soaked these for 6 hours before playing with them. Once my children were playing with them for 30 min to 1 hour at least 25% of the beads began to break into pieces. I had hoped we would get more play time or multiple uses out of them. They are still fun to play with and cheap enough to keep buying for special occasions or once in a while fun.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Family

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not for smaller kids
customer_reviews.text: Some water beads get larger and larger the longer you leave them in water. These reach their potential size at about 4 hours. (Even though the instructions says 6-10 hours, dont waste your time. The balls will not get any bigger.) I was hoping they would get big enough that my 1 year old could also play with them but they did not. My 3 year old loves them though.
customer_reviews.author: courtschu

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old loves them!
customer_reviews.text: This product is my only experience with “orbees”, so if you have used others, keep that in mind. These are very pretty colors and super fun for my 2 year old. She loves to sort them, dip them from one container to another, etc. Negative qualities: Take 6+ hours to “grow”, and they do rip apart fairly easily. All things considered though, super cool product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: cnix

customer_reviews.title: Kids absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 and 10 year olds to have fun with and it has exceeded expectations. They loved watching them grow and coming up with ideas on how to incorporate it into their play. I've also used a few for Pinterest ideas. After all of this, there is still more than 3/4 of the bag for future use. Would definitely buy again if we ever run out and would gift to others. Definitely not for very small children as they can look like something edible.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly P.

customer_reviews.title: Super value, fun product!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay if your kids like slime, or orbeez these things are for you!! A regular bottle of orbeez are 4.99 I would say that that equals about a teaspoon and a half of these dried beads!!! For 6 some dollars you get enough to fill a bathtub!!! My 5 year old LOVE LOVE LOVES these things! She also loved watching them grow! I would recommend and I will purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Thayl Lane

customer_reviews.title: Great sensory "toy" for kids of all ages
customer_reviews.text: I bought these water beads for a children's program I administer in Jamaica after playing with the ones my grandson has. I can't wait for the kids to experience them. My 3-year-old grandson loves to dip his hand into a bucket of them and just let them swish around. I find them to be very relaxing to play with. I would recommend these beads to anyone who enjoys sensory experiences, regardless of their age.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hengeveld-Bidmon

customer_reviews.title: Good price but break very easily.
customer_reviews.text: So these water beads were a really good price. They had lots and lots of good reviews so I went with them. Unfortunately I was expecting them to be like or so these water beads were a really good price. They had lots and lots of good reviews so I went with them. Unfortunately I was expecting them to be like oebeez... they are not. They are a lot weaker. Meaning that they break easily. I was right there with my kids making sure that they were not purposely breaking them and so many ended up broken just in 35 minutes of play. I would probably purchase the name brand of next time.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Timmerman

customer_reviews.title: So much Fun
customer_reviews.text: So much product. I took these to a birthday party . filled a large tray with them for 12 thru 6 year olds and everyone of them loved them. From watching them grow to playing with them and seeing the light reflect off the colors. We ended up making party gifts by putting some in water bottles so everyone could take some home. And still have 80% of the package left. Great fun for just a little money
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysLearning

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pastel Beads
customer_reviews.text: For a gallon ziploc bag, I's suggest 1 teaspoon of beads. Other reviewers said there were so many water beads that it was overwhelming. So I just did half of the 'recipe'. I should have done the whole recipe, as the gallon bag didn't fill up with enough water beads. However, I'll do it right the next time. I bought these for my 3 month old grandson for tummy time. The beads are not brightly colored, more pastel colored.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I actually was really impressed with these beads. The bag is smaller than I thought it would be receiving it. However, I had no experience with water beads. Our kids loved them! They will last a long time for us. We did try to dry them back out to save them, and they molded before they dried. But it was only about a tsp worth of beads. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ajleishman

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to let me son explore and use on a sensory play day! He LOVES them and quite frankly, so do I! I was skeptical using 3 whole cups of water to ONE TEASPOON of these beads but they weren’t kidding! They expand like crazy! And only in about 3 hours! We played for so long, and when we were done I laid them on a towel and they shrank right back up! I am so happy to see you’re able to reuse them (I’m not sure how many times) because there are SO many! Such a great way to keep kids entertained and so inexpensive, really. What a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these things! Super simple to play with and not as messy as you may think. Be prepared for them to grow. We used a small bit in a standard sized baking dish and they grew to about blueberry size each almost spilling out of the dish as they grew. Lots of fun for the kiddos and definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for a special needs or typically developing child
customer_reviews.text: Bought this per request of a therapist for a special needs child. She is almost 2 but developmentally about 1 year. This is for supervised play with a child this young but her 3 yr old sister loves them too. The product comes in a small package that you hydrate 1 teaspoon to 3 cups water over 6 hours then drain. Product lasts well and is a quality product. You can toss the used portion or let air dry back to its original micro size to hydrate on another day.
customer_reviews.author: FaneFive

customer_reviews.title: FUN FUN FUN
customer_reviews.text: I bought two bags of these for 4 of my grand kids (one with disabilities) - ages 2 1/2 to 12. Spread them between 4 storage tubs. Then the kids went wild!!!! They played in them, sat in the tubs and played for hours. Don't tell anyone, but later, when they were inside, I went out and put my feet in and relaxed for about an hour. I don't know what it is but these things are quite relaxing!!! HA HA I recommend these for kids and adults.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Jolene Messmer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun..
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun product for the whole family.. we use them in my daughters occupational therapy (that's how I learned about them) and it's an amazing product for any sensory processing kid/teen/adult. I ordered it for my 6yr old who has sensory processing disorder (among many other medical diagnoses) and she can spend hours playing with them. My teen & preteen loves them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Studzinski

customer_reviews.title: Sensory Magic
customer_reviews.text: This sensory ball set is great for sensory activities. They absorb water quickly and become marble sized balls. My daughter loves them and they last a good while. They are biodegradable. I didn’t love the clean up. If they happen to get in the driveway they are tough to clean up. They also get stuck in grass and hard to get out. Overall great product keep out of grass.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Ard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these beads for a sensory bottle for my toddlers. The instructions were simple and I love the result! Just note that they come in 2 bags. Don't do what I did and assume the 2nd bag (the one that holds the actual beads) isn't also a ziplock. I cut the corner off the, what I know now, is the bottom. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: MysticFire

customer_reviews.title: Buy them! Perfect size and HOURS of fun!
customer_reviews.text: These water beads are AMAZING and provide hours of fun for my son (and myself 😉). A little scoop goes a LONG way! We love filling little plastic pools with these beads and scooping them with measuring spoons. These are perfect for sensory bins. Will definitely purchase again, and probably on a weekly basis to make the summer days more fun. Buy them! You will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: hwhitneyb

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to put on the trampoline. Everyone loves jumping with them. We put a bunch in the pool to swim with but they lay on the bottom unless they are stirred up. Still fun. They grow to the size of a small marble and unless you jump on them (trampoline) they are fairly durable. We bought one bag and just ordered two more.
customer_reviews.author: RB931

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy with Hours of Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Beads hydrated to a really nice size, even had a few extra large beads included that really excited my 3 year old twins. Took about a good 6 hours to get a nice marble size. My kiddos really enjoyed themselves for about 2 hours or longer and the beads lasted for 3 days before my kids found it just as exciting to stomp on them. Great colors too!
customer_reviews.author: Wife, MS

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for toddler play
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited about these for my 2.5 year old. Added ~8 teaspoons with the recommended amount of water to a plastic tub. They expanded nicely within 3-4 hours, although I did let them sit for the recommended 6-8 hours. My complaint is that they are not very sturdy, especially for toddler play. After 30-60 minutes of play, at least 25% are broken. I find myself constantly fishing out the broken ones, which turns out to be a losing battle. For the price, I would still say it’s worth it. But i was hoping for something that would last a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the money for a couple of fun days! We filled up an old sand box with water and dropped two packages in. The time lapse is from my 10 year old. Not the Orbee explosion we were initially looking for, but super fun. And better yet! The second day, they continued to absorb water and got bigger-completely filling up the pool. They will continue to absorb water over the course of a couple days and then break apart and disintegrate. Making for even easier clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia R.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment for a great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and the quantity is plenty to give my kids tons of small batches to play with. We soak 3 Tablespoons of beads per batch which fills the bottom of an 18 QT. sterilite container about 1 inch high. Each batch lasts about a week before mold starts to grow and I throw them out. I haven't quite figured out how to dry them out for reuse yet. Still well worth it for the hours upon hours my daughters have sat scooping and playing with the beads.
customer_reviews.author: Draper44

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my son's sensory table.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect! I bought my son a sensory table and needed something that wasn't as messy as sand or water and these work perfectly. I barely used any and to my surprise they expanded tremendously. My son is very happy with these. I love that they are non toxic. I havent tried to dry them out yet. Hopefully that works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kali Hatch

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic 'toy' for my little one
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter can spend an hour sifting through her water beads. Transferring from cup to cup, digging her fingers through them all. A great addition to her discovery box. They hold up for days and days and for the few water beads that make it out of the bin, they do squish, but it doesn't create a hard to clean mess. Which I love!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Anne

customer_reviews.title: Colorful but break easily. Try another brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand after reading many reviews for different brands of water beads. They’re easy to use and I made them following instructions for the amount of time to soak. They came out in various sizes. However they break extremely easily. My boys played with them for about 20 mins and most of them broke into pieces. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cin K

product_meta.title: MarvelBeads Water Beads Rainbow Mix (Half Pound) for Spa Refill, Sensory Toys and Décor (Non-Toxic)
product_meta.description: New 2016 Enhanced Color Edition! BRIGHT. COLORFUL. COLORFAST. Introducing our new enhanced color edition! The new MarvelBeads 2016 water beads are filled with better and brighter colors. Whether you use them for playtime, or for decorations, the beads will create a colorful display that is sure to be memorable. Best of all: you can reuse the beads as many times as you want, and not have to worry about them losing their color. Sensory Water Beads Sensory play is what water beads are best for. Kids of all ages will love them. They are so enticing! Colorful, smooth, squishy... what more could you ask for to have an enjoyable time. Water beads seem like magic to kids because the beads start out so tiny and grow within a few hours. Just watching the beads grow is an experience in itself. So go ahead, and fill up a bowl to plunge your hands in. Or maybe fill up a bucket to soak your feet in. The possibilities are endless! Uses General Decorations Makes a great toy for children. Wedding decorations Irrigating and Watering House Plants Can be used to complement center pieces and or flower vases How to use 1.) Add 3 cups of water for every teaspoon of dry beads. 2.) Allow for the beads to soak in water for 4-6 hours 3.) After 4-6 hours, the beads will have absorbed most of the water. Drain the excess water and use them as you wish
feature_bullets: Encourages Sensory Exploration: Fully expanded, these smooth, squishy beads create a soothing tactile experience. Ideal for children with sensory processing disorder & a
100% Money-Back Guarantee: We know you and your kids or students will LOVE these water beads. But if you're not positively thrilled, let us know and receive a fast, no hassle refund.
Promotes Learning: Helps kids with color recognition, counting & fine motor skill and language development. Parents, teachers, and therapists love these beads for home & clinical use.
Great for Wedding, Home, and general decorations.
Ideal for candle, silk & cut flower arrangements, centerpieces and more.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,741 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
